title: Underwriting Data Analyst
description:
Overview:

AAA Life Insurance Company is seeking an Underwriting Data Analyst to ensure that AAA Life Insurance makes effective business and operational decisions. As an Underwriting Data Analyst, you will be at the forefront of transforming data into actionable insights. This role involves extracting, analyzing, and visualizing data to provide valuable recommendations that drive underwriting strategies and decision-making.
Responsibilities:
* Analyze underwriting data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimization.
* Develop and implement data models and analytical frameworks to support underwriting decisions and strategies.
* Conduct in-depth analysis of underwriting performance metrics to identify key drivers of profitability and risk.
* Create comprehensive reports and dashboards to communicate analytical findings to senior leadership and other stakeholders.
* Present complex data and insights in a clear, concise, and visually compelling manner.
* Regularly update leadership on key underwriting metrics, trends, and strategic initiatives progress.
* Ensure the accuracy, integrity, and consistency of underwriting data through rigorous data quality checks and governance practices.
* Collaborate with data management teams to enhance data infrastructure and ensure the availability of relevant data sources for analysis.
* Develop and maintain data documentation and standards to support consistent and accurate analysis.


Qualifications:
* Bachelor in Statistics, Marketing, Economics, Computer Science, or related technical field. Master’s degree is a plus.
* A minimum of two years’ experience working as a Data Analyst, Marketing Analyst, or similar role.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (i.e., Python, R, SQL).
* Ability to create and interpret reports and dashboards using Power BI, Tableau, or similar data visualization tools.
* Experience with life insurance underwriting data and processes.
* Strong knowledge of statistical methods, predictive modeling, and actuarial concepts.
* Familiarity with data warehousing, data governance, and data quality management.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

**What We Offer:**

* A collaborative, energetic work environment where you can put your passion for people to work
* Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability coverage available day one
* Pension Plan
* Performance-based incentive plan
* 401k available with a Company match
* Holidays and Paid Time Off
* AAA Basic Membership


PM21


Compensation Disclaimer (Text Only): For the states of California, Colorado, New York and Washington the pay scale is $84,000 to $126,000 and pay scales may vary based upon location.

title: Associate Business Analyst (BioHealth)
description:
**Join our team! We have an exciting opening for a full-time** ***Associate Business Analyst*** **to join our innovative Service Delivery team in Madison, Wisconsin!**

  

The BioHealth practice at Yahara provides IT consulting to companies ranging from small start ups to large corporates and the Government sector. Examples areas of Yahara’s BioHealth practice IT consulting are Laboratory Process Automation and Analytics, Medical and Pharmaceutical Instrumentation Product Development, Electronic Records, Quality Management System, Security Compliance, Medical Device Integration with Health Care Electronic Records, Clinical Trial Management and Biotech Manufacturing.

  



The BioHealth Associate Business Analyst is focused on providing level one business analysis services for a max of 2-3 small projects and with support from higher level Business Analysts. Projects will Providing project support to internal teams, this role will collaborate closely with the project technical teams, project sponsors, and project managers. The Associate Business Analyst will work directly with clients to identify technical needs and work to manage communication around future state and progress, servicing as the voice of Yahara. The Associate Business Analyst will report directly to the Business Analysis Practice Manager.

 **Responsibilities****:**

* Conduct sessions with stakeholders to discuss current-state scientific and business processes and gather future-state needs.
* Understand and analyze parts of client’s larger scientific workflow such as chromatography, stem cell manufacturing, genome sequencing, radiation therapy etc. and participate in the assessment of how automated systems can be leveraged for implementation.
* Connect scientific requirements with overall business needs.
* Utilize requirements analysis tools such as flow charts, sequence diagrams, entity relationship diagrams etc to depict current-state and suture-state scientific and business processes.
* Serve as a liaison between the development team and client to ensure technical feasibility and alignment with scientific and business needs.
* Accurate note taking in communicating decisions, action items, and next steps for requirements gathering to team members post meetings.
* Organize requirements into feature-sets and prioritize them into ‘mandatory’ versus ‘desired’ buckets.
* Convert requirements and solutions designed in collaboration with Tech lead into user/technical stories in support of software development activities such as estimating, development and testing.
* Track requirements as they progress through development activities.
* Utilize rapid prototyping tools such as JustinMind, Sketch, or Zephyr to facilitate development and maximize usability of application features.
* Serve as liaison between Yahara and its clients to gather testing feedback and prioritizing bug fixes.
* Follow Agile software development practices and lead scrum cadences for backlog grooming, estimation and sprint planning.
* Stay up to date and incorporating learnings from IIBA, scrum.org, scrum alliance, or other industry standard entities for software development best practices.
* Provide support to higher level Business Analysts.

  


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Biology, Biomedical Engineering, Biotechnology, Chemistry, and related fields.
* Familiarity with analytical laboratory processes, experiment procedures and common terms in the LifeScience domain.
* Exceptional analytical and critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
* Demonstrated ability to problem solve in a scientific or technical environment.
* Interest in concepts related to user interface or user experience and the software development lifecycle.
* Interest in exploring how IT systems, processes or technology can improve user experience.
* Demonstrated interpersonal, collaborative, and relationship-building skills.
* Experience using Word, Excel, and Outlook and demonstrated ability to quickly learn a new software tool.
* Demonstrated ability to develop formal documentation such as standard operating procedures, reports, requirements, presentations to team members or higher authorities.
* Demonstrated high degree of initiative and ownership; proactively works to resolve issues.
* Demonstrated ability to build trust and create lasting relationships. Must have experience working on a team.
* Demonstrated ability to escalate and work through roadblocks.
* Able to learn new technology well enough to communicate with technology experts.

  


**Preferred Requirements****:**

* Prior experience in the LifeScience Domain.

  


**Company Benefits & Perks:**


* Over 20+ days of PTO accruable in the first year of employment!
* Health insurance options to best fit you and your family’s needs (Medical, Dental, and Vision)
	+ HMO (copay or high-deductible health plan)
	+ PPO
* Health Savings Account (HSA) option with annual employer contributions
* Flexible Savings Account (FSA) availability
* 401(k) options (Both Traditional and Roth) with guaranteed company match
* 100% company paid short-term and long-term disability
* 100% company paid life insurance plans with option to increase coverage
* On-site gym membership including basketball court
* Fresh fruit, healthy snacks, and beverages provided in office daily
* Hybrid and remote schedule availability for most positions with home office stipend
* Company supported community outreach/team volunteer opportunities
* Monthly and Quarterly Employee Recognition Awards with spot bonuses for outstanding contributions
* Bonus certification program for career development (Microsoft, AWS, PMP, IIBA, etc.)
* Employee Assistance Program includes:
	+ Professional counselling for emotional wellness and life coaching
	+ Legal and financial consultation and services
* 100% company paid identity theft protection plan
* Employee-run committee opportunity involvement
* Collaborative and engaged company culture founded on realized values and incredible people

  



If you need an accommodation as part of the employment process, please contact Human Resources via email at hradmin@yaharasoftware.com

  


*Yahara Software LLC. Is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.*


*The current opening positions listed are full-time, in-house salaried position with competitive salary and benefits. Candidates must be eligible to work in the U.S on a permanent basis and can work on-site in our office located in Madison, Wisconsin. We are unable to provide any sponsorship at this time.*

title: Business Data Analyst
description:
**Job Title :** Business Data Analyst
  
  

Work Location Remote in San Francisco-CA
  
  

**Required Skills :** , GraphQL, PostgreSQL
  
  

Job summary
  
  

We are seeking a highly skilled Business Analyst with 6 to 10 years of experience to join our team as a Business Associate.
  
  

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in PostgreSQL and GraphQL, and will be responsible for analyzing business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing solutions that drive efficiency and effectiveness.
  
  

This role will play a crucial part in supporting our companies mission and contributing to societal impact.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

Analyze business processes to identify areas for improvement and optimization.
  
  

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and document business requirements.
  
  

Develop detailed business analysis, outlining problems, opportunities, and solutions.
  
  

Utilize PostgreSQL to manage and analyze large datasets effectively.
  
  

Implement GraphQL to streamline data querying and improve application performance.
  
  

Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of business processes and systems.
  
  

Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support decision-making.
  
  

Develop and deliver presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
  
  

Work closely with IT teams to ensure seamless integration of new solutions
  
  

Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of implemented solutions and make necessary adjustments.
  
  

Ensure that all business analysis activities align with company goals and objectives.
  
  

Support project management activities, including planning, execution, and monitoring.
  
  

Conduct training sessions for end-users to ensure successful adoption of new systems and processes.
  
  

Qualifications
  
  

Possess a strong understanding of business analysis methodologies and tools.
  
  

Demonstrate proficiency in PostgreSQL for data management and analysis.
  
  

Exhibit expertise in GraphQL for efficient data querying and application performance.
  
  

Show excellent communication and presentation skills.
  
  

Have a proven track record of successfully implementing business solutions.
  
  

Display strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
  
  

Be able to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
  
  

Hold a bachelors degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field.
  
  

Have experience in project management and process improvement.
  
  

Be detail-oriented and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
  
  

Show a commitment to continuous learning and professional development.
  
  

**Years of Experience:** 10.00 Years of Experience

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Dynamic Solutions Technology, LLC,** a premier strategic services firm that meets IT and Service needs for commercial and government clients, is seeking full-time **Senior Business Process Analyst**. This remote exempt position is in support of the customer based out of the DMV.


**Experience Required**

* Perform process analysis, data modeling, improvement identification, and requirements analysis against the existing execution plan and IT/Application Strategies, process framework, value streams, and externally interfacing policy and processes
* IT Process and procedures documentation and Technical Writing expertise
* Expert with Microsoft Software Programs (Visio, Project, Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
* Ability to understand requirements and their impact on technical directions of a solution
* Ability to maintain professionalism and react to customers appropriately, while exhibiting the highest level of customer service
* Ability to work independently and as a team member in a fast-paced development process
* Assist in the development and manage roadmaps utilizing approved tools and leveraging industry best practices and fully capture the program's statement of work and scope, and illustrate the work in-progress and planned for initiatives and projects with anticipated milestones
* Perform Critical Path Analysis (CPA) and actively update the IMS as established in the projects Baseline Control documentation, utilize the IMS to support EVM efforts, perform "What-if" analysis, and report on the best corrective action needed to keep projects on schedule
* Ability to develop, document, and ensure adherence to technical standards
* Must be self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to sustain your own assigned project work in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
* Ability to receive direction from multiple managers, and support multiple team members simultaneously
* Ability to multitask
* Must be highly organized and a self-starter
* Must be able to communicate effectively and confidently with team members and management
* Must be flexible and willing to undertake a wide variety of challenging tasks
* Strong facilitation skills.
* Proven experience at driving consensus across multiple stakeholders
* Process driven analysis skills and a background in various requirements elicitation methods
* Commitment to responsiveness and achieving tasks on deadline
* Flexible team player

**Qualifications Requirements:**

* Ability to obtain a Public Trust background clearance
* Bachelor's degree in a technology related field
* Min 10 years of relevant focused experience
* Agile Development practices

**Desired Qualifications*****:***

* Excellent oral and written skills.
* Excellent critical thinking skills.
* Proficient in Microsoft applications such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
* Experience with budgeting and estimation for future program requirements
* PMP/PMI certification
* Quality Certification (ITIL, or other)

title: Data & Insights Analyst
description:
**Introduction**:

Discover a world of endless possibilities at Gallagher Benefit Services, where you'll have the power to shape the future of workplaces across industries. As a member of our team, you become the driving force behind positive change, helping clients build environments where employees thrive. Embrace the opportunity to impact lives, unlock potential, and create a legacy of remarkable transformation.  

We believe that every candidate brings something special to the table, including you! So, even if you feel that you’re close but not an exact match, we encourage you to apply.
**How you'll make an impact**:
* Primarily focused on providing technical expertise in the sale, placement, and service of employee benefits. This position will work closely with the Client to provide strategic guidance, partnering as the daily go-to benefits professional.
* This role builds and maintains effective business relationships with clients through proactive client service, effective management of renewals, accurate and timely responses to inquiries, and ongoing problem resolution.
* Lead contact and day-to-day administrator responsible for assigned clients.
* Analyzes and interprets plan rules to ensure compliance with plan documents and summary plan descriptions (SPD).
* Manages special projects as needed. Contributes to policy and benefit plan development through review, analysis, and improvement recommendations.
* Maintains an ongoing effort to determine and maintain equity with current benefit trends and legislated requirements and programs.
* Serves as technical or functional expert.
* May provide guidance to lower level staff, but has no formal supervisory responsibility.


**About you**:

Required: Bachelors degree and 5 years related experience required. Understanding of the key challenges in employee benefit plans and current health care trends. Excellent client relationship-building and presentation skills.
  

  

Preferred: 2-3 years brokerage/agency experience preferred.
  

  

Behaviors: Ability to coordinate multiple projects while ensuring timely and accurate client deliverables, with effective problem solving and resolution skills. Strong organizational, project planning and management, analytical, and multi-tasking skills.
**Compensation and benefits**:

On top of a competitive salary, great teams and exciting career opportunities, we also offer a wide range of benefits.
 

Below are the **minimum core benefits** you’ll get, depending on your job level these benefits may improve:


* Medical/dental/vision plans, which start from day one!
* Life and accident insurance
* 401(K) and Roth options
* Tax-advantaged accounts (HSA, FSA)
* Educational expense reimbursement
* Paid parental leave

**Other benefits include:**

* Digital mental health services (Talkspace)
* Flexible work hours (availability varies by office and job function)
* Training programs
* Gallagher Thrive program – elevating your health through challenges, workshops and digital fitness programs for your overall wellbeing
* Charitable matching gift program
* And more...

**We value inclusion and diversity**


Click Here to review our U.S. Eligibility Requirements


Inclusion and diversity (I&D) is a core part of our business, and it’s embedded into the fabric of our organization. For more than 95 years, Gallagher has led with a commitment to sustainability and to support the communities where we live and work.


Gallagher embraces our employees’ diverse identities, experiences and talents, allowing us to better serve our clients and communities. We see inclusion as a conscious commitment and diversity as a vital strength. By embracing diversity in all its forms, we live out The Gallagher Way to its fullest.


Gallagher believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity and prohibits any form of discrimination by its managers, employees, vendors or customers based on race, color, religion, creed, gender (including pregnancy status), sexual orientation, gender identity (which includes transgender and other gender non-conforming individuals), gender expression, hair expression, marital status, parental status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected (herein referred to as “protected characteristics”) by applicable federal, state, or local laws.


Equal employment opportunity will be extended in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, layoff, and termination. In addition, Gallagher will make reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified person with a disability, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.

title: Business Analyst 2
description:
**THE POSITION**
----------------


An exciting opportunity has arisen as an administrative and technical Business Analyst 2 within the business application development section of the Pennsylvania Department of Transportation’s Driver and Vehicle Services Program Management Office. Your role involves overseeing team members tasked with creating test scripts, preparing documentation, and analyzing defects related to our titling and registration applications. This position offers a platform to demonstrate your organizational capabilities while advancing your professional journey. Seize this opportunity to contribute to the efficiency and effectiveness of the Driver and Vehicle Services Program.  


**DESCRIPTION OF WORK**
-----------------------


In this role, you will oversee and participate in the system development life cycle of applications. You will manage a team responsible for creating test scripts, documentation, and analyzing defects in our titling and registration applications. Additionally, you will coordinate resources for testing activities and handle administrative tasks such as project planning, test plans, requirements gathering, and project status updates.  

  

You will deliver concise status reports to executive management, business areas, vendors, and other stakeholders regarding progress, issues, and events related to ongoing enhancement and defect efforts. You will engage in verbal and written communication with various external management personnel, acting as a bridge between staff making system changes and coding. Furthermore, you will be involved in analytical tasks supporting the adaptation of electronic data processing methods to multiple applications, as well as work-measurements, work-simplification, and manpower-utilization studies.  

  

Interested in learning more? Additional details regarding this position can be found in the position description.  

  

**Work Schedule and Additional Information:**

  

* Full-time employment
* Work hours are 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM, Monday - Friday, with 60-minute lunch.
* This position may be required to work during office closures.
* **Telework:** You may have the opportunity to work from home (telework) part-time. In order to telework, you must have a securely configured high-speed internet connection and work from an approved location inside Pennsylvania. If you are unable to telework, you will have the option to report to the headquarters office in Harrisburg.
* **Salary:**In some cases, the starting salary may be non-negotiable.
* You will receive further communication regarding this position via email. Check your email, including spam/junk folders, for these notices.

**REQUIRED EXPERIENCE, TRAINING & ELIGIBILITY**
-----------------------------------------------


**QUALIFICATIONS****Minimum Experience and Training Requirements:*** Five years of business process analysis experience;**or**
* One year as a Business Analyst 1;**or**
* One year as an Information Technology Trainee; **or**
* One year of business process analysis experience and a bachelor’s degree; **or**
* An equivalent combination of experience and training.

 **Other Requirements:*** You must meet the PA residency requirement. For more information on ways to meet PA residency requirements, follow the link and click on Residency.
* You must be able to perform essential job functions.

 **Legal Requirements:*** This position requires the selected candidate to undergo and pass a Fingerprint and Name-Based Criminal History Check prior to employment.

 **How to Apply:*** Resumes, cover letters, and similar documents will **not** be reviewed, and the information contained therein will not be considered for the purposes of determining your eligibility for the position. Information to support your eligibility for the position must be provided on the application (i.e., relevant, detailed experience/education).
* If you are claiming education in your answers to the supplemental application questions, you must attach a copy of your college transcripts for your claim to be accepted toward meeting the minimum requirements. Unofficial transcripts are acceptable.
* Your application must be submitted by the posting closing date*.* Late applications and other required materials will not be accepted.
* **Failure to comply with the above application requirements may eliminate you from consideration for this position.**

 **Veterans:*** Pennsylvania law (51 Pa. C.S. §7103) provides employment preference for qualified veterans for appointment to many state and local government jobs. To learn more about employment preferences for veterans, go to www.employment.pa.gov/Additional%20Info/Pages/default.aspx and click the Veterans’ Preference tab or contact us at ra-cs-vetpreference@pa.gov.
 **Telecommunications Relay Service (TRS):*** 711 (hearing and speech disabilities or other individuals).
  

If you are contacted for an interview and need accommodations due to a disability, please discuss your request for accommodations with the interviewer in advance of your interview date.  

The Commonwealth is an equal employment opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse workforce. The Commonwealth values inclusion as we seek to recruit, develop, and retain the most qualified people to serve the citizens of Pennsylvania. The Commonwealth does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religious creed, ancestry, union membership, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, AIDS or HIV status, disability, or any other categories protected by applicable federal or state law. All diverse candidates are encouraged to apply.
**EXAMINATION INFORMATION**
---------------------------


* Completing the application, including all supplemental questions, serves as your exam for this position. No additional exam is required at a test center (also referred to as a written exam).
* Your score is based on the detailed information you provide on your application and in response to the supplemental questions.
* Your score is valid for this specific posting only.
* You must provide complete and accurate information or:
	+ your score may be lower than deserved.
	+ you may be disqualified.
* You may only apply/test **once** for this posting.
* Your results will be provided via email.

  
Learn more about our Total Rewards by watching this short video!

**Health & Wellness**

We offer multiple health plans so our employees can choose what works best for themselves and their families. Our comprehensive benefits package includes health coverage, vision, dental, and wellness programs.\*

  

**Compensation & Financial Planning**  

We invest in our employees by providing competitive wages and encouraging financial wellness by offering multiple ways to save money and ensure peace of mind including multiple retirement and investment plan options.   

  

**Work/Life Balance**  

We know there’s more to life than just work! Our generous paid leave benefits include paid vacation, paid sick leave, eight weeks of paid parental leave, military leave, and paid time off for most major U.S. holidays, as well as flexible work schedules and work-from-home opportunities.\*   

  

**Values and Culture**  

We believe in the work we do and provide continual opportunities for our employees to grow and contribute to the greater good. As one of the largest employers in the state, we provide opportunities for internal mobility, professional development, and the opportunity to give back by participating in workplace charitable giving.  

  

**Employee Perks**  

Sometimes, it is the little “extras” that make a big difference. Our employees receive special employee-only discounts and rates on a variety of services and memberships.  

  

For more information on all of these Total Rewards benefits, please visit www.employment.pa.gov and click on the benefits box.  

  

* Eligibility rules apply.

title: Business Analyst, TESS
description:
* 1+ years of tax, finance or a related analytical field experience
* 2+ years of complex Excel VBA macros writing experience
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent
* Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
* Experience with SQL or ETL


At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and customer obsessed people. As a Business Analyst for Transportation Engineering Systems Team, (TESS), you will be responsible for developing, enhancing, automating and managing business models/dashboards using strong quantitative skills. You will also build tools and support structures needed to analyze data, deep dive root causes of operational issues or challenges, drive process improvements, build KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) and metrics, and document systems and processes for internal publication.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
* Own the design, development, maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analysis, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.
* Writing high quality SQL codes to retrieve and analyze data and experience working with large data sets, automate data extraction, and build monitoring/reporting dashboard
* Propose, define and align leaders on the right metrics to track business performance and own end-to-end production of these metrics.
* Formulate analytical business problem statements, executing the analysis and presenting insights in crisp business language.
* Develop clear communications for recommended actions. Able to communicate complex analysis and insights to our stakeholders and business leaders, both verbally and in writing.
* Establish new, scalable, efficient, automated processes for tracking and reporting on progress of initiatives. This includes causal analysis on program launches and its impact on the business.
* Solve ambiguous problems and proactively identify and mitigate risks (before they become roadblocks)
* Work with program managers, business owners and leadership impacting critical business initiatives. Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.


About the team
  
TESS manages transportation network configuration by working with different internal stakeholders and systems, to deliver desired business outcomes. We work at the intersection of business and systems. Your work will directly influence the decisions and strategy of TESS by gathering customer needs and insights, mining large and diverse data sets. You will work with business leaders, their teams, and their various stakeholders to track various business goals and initiatives. The ideal candidate is a natural self-starter who is comfortable working within a cross functional environment, supporting multiple stakeholders and initiatives. You will have a true hands-on approach, strong analytical skills, including the ability to gain true insights from data, and be an effective communicator. - Collect, identify, and prioritize analytical problem statements to ensure the BI team works on the highest impact projects and earn stakeholder trust.
  
  

* Experience working with Tableau
* Experience using very large datasets


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
  
  

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $50,200/year in our lowest geographic market up to $107,400/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Job Title: Business Analyst**

**Location: Raleigh ,NC**

**Job Type: Hybrid**

**Contract Length: 8 Months Contract with Possible Extension**

**Pay-rate:** **$54/Hour** 

**DESCRIPTION OF WORK:**

This senior Business Analyst role will work with multiple internal and external stakeholders to capture requirements, business process workflows and develop other BA artifacts using North Carolina Department of Information Technology Business Analysis Team tools and templates. The DHHS’ preference is to use the agile methodology for the project.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**-

* Develop a strong understanding of the functions, uses and requirements for the Lab Information Management System (LIMS)
* Identifying and documenting current and future state process workflows

•Developing documents such as: Business objects inventory list Reports, email notifications and Forms List, Email Notifications/Letters Inventory List, User Stories, Permission Matrix, Wireframes

* Additional development of documents may include but is not limited to entity relationship diagrams, data dictionaries, system context diagrams
* Assisting in performing functional and integrated testing

•Preparing and maintaining project documentation and artifacts including analysis, reports and user documentation

* Working with project manager, developers, and end-users to ensure LIMS designs meet business requirements

•Providing UAT support, including developing test scenarios and cases using DHHS methodology

* Supporting required system go-live activities
* Documenting gap analysis
* Track delivery and review/approval progress of each deliverable in accordance with approved Project Work Plan and RACI

•Attending PMO meetings

•Demonstrated experience participating in the documentation of functional requirements and technical specifications for existing and new applications

•Strong writing and communication skills

•Results-oriented individual with a very strong work ethic and must be able to demonstrate excellent negotiation, communication and problem-solving skills

•Ability to work with customers as a member of cross-divisional work groups and maintain positive and productive relationships with customers, peers, and superiors

•Ability to act independently with sound business judgment and thrive in environment with diverse communication styles

•Ability to prepare and present oral and written documents clearly and concisely

•Ability to manage complex assignments with multiple work streams and aggressive (and sometimes competing) timelines

•Understanding of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) concepts and process

* Knowledge of and experience with IT Service Management best practices and principles

•Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (MS Word, EXCEL, PowerPoint, Visio) and Microsoft Project

* Extensive understanding of SharePoint end user experience, sites, libraries, lists and groups

•Lab Information Management System (LIMS) or other health systems experience is desired

•Must have familiarity with agile methodology, tools and frameworks, i.e. scrum, kanban

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $54.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* State government , local ,federal gov: 1 year (Required)

* business system analysis techniques and testing: 7 years (Required)
* gathering business requirements and development of business: 7 years (Required)
* business process design, definition and/or re-design: 7 years (Required)
* Business Analysis methodologies and problem solving: 7 years (Required)

* agile methodology, tools and frameworks, i.e. scrum, kanban: 3 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* U.S Citizenship or Green Card (Required)

Ability to Commute:

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Raleigh, NC 27603

title: Operational Business Analyst
description:
**Operational Business Analyst**

  

Looking for an exciting and challenging opportunity to put your analytical and problem-solving skills to work? Join our team as an Operational Business Analyst at DHL!


In this dynamic role, you'll play a key role in all operating activities, including customer demand/volume planning, warehouse productivity, labor efficiency, and more. You'll be responsible for auditing vendor payables, providing accurate hourly activity reporting, and providing analytical support to managers and supervisors as needed.

  

To succeed in this role, you'll need to be a problem solver, a strategic thinker, and an expert in financial and operational analysis. You'll be confident working independently, managing priorities, and juggling multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.

**What we're looking for:**

* Audit vendor payables for accuracy and ensure appropriate approvals are obtained prior to payment
* Execute daily customer / vendor contract requirements and identify accessorial activity and ensure necessary documentation
* Work with Operations and HR department associates on a daily basis, providing support and assistance as needed
* Provide support to Kronos application and set-up to ensure accurate hourly activity reporting
* Interact with Managers and Supervisors to provide analytical support as needed
* Direct involvement with Accounting and Commercial Finance departments
* Provide ad-hoc analytical support to operations personnel in all areas of the operation as needed and requested
* Prepare month end close accrual and reclass journal entries
* Assist as needed with accounts receivable processing, collection, proper revenue reporting, and account payable processing
* Reconcile Purchase Orders as support to expense recognition
* Prepare daily and weekly labor analysis reports for operations productivity analysis
* Participate in the collection of performance measurements consistent with customer, vendor, and site requirements
* Ownership of balance sheets (black-line) account reconciliations

 **Requirements**

title: Healthcare Data Analyst
description:
Are you an experienced healthcare professional with a knack for data analysis and a keen eye for detail? We're looking for a dedicated Healthcare Data Manager to design, develop and generate production reports while ensuring the accuracy and integrity of patient charts. If you have strong analytical skills, proficiency in Excel, and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving, we want to hear from you!

\*\*\* Only San Diego local candidates need apply please\*\*\*

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Medical Data Reporting:** Manage the accurate and timely reporting of medical data. Ensure all reports are generated, reviewed, and distributed in compliance with healthcare regulations and organizational standards.
* **Data Analysis:** Conduct comprehensive analysis of medical data to identify trends, discrepancies, and opportunities for improvement. Provide actionable insights to enhance operational efficiency and patient care.
* **Billing and Coding:** Assist with billing and coding processes to ensure accurate coding of diagnoses, procedures, and treatments. Review and validate coding practices to maintain compliance with regulatory requirements.
* **Patient Chart Review:** Perform detailed reviews of patient charts to verify accuracy, completeness, and adherence to medical documentation standards. Address and resolve any discrepancies or issues identified.
* **Team Supervision:** Assist the operations manager to supervise the admin staff
* **Attention to Detail:** Maintain a high level of accuracy and thoroughness in all tasks. Ensure meticulous documentation and adherence to established protocols.
* **Excel Expertise:** Utilize advanced Excel skills to manage and analyze large datasets, create reports, and develop data models.
* **Problem Solving:** Apply common sense and practical solutions to address challenges and streamline processes.

**Qualifications/Skills:**

o The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy providing a high level of patient service

· 2-3 years Epic experience required

· 2-3 years healthcare data management experience required

· Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including advanced functions and data manipulation.

· Patient Scheduling, registration or similar experience required

· Effective verbal and written communication skills

· Excellent organization skills

· Good judgement

· Resourcefulness in problem solving

· Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in medical documentation and reporting.

* **Skills:**
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive hourly wage within the pay range of $23 - $25.
* Opportunities for professional development and career growth.
* Health, dental, and vision insurance options.
* Paid time off and holidays.

title: Billing Analyst
description:
Job Description
SUMMARY: The Billing Analyst compiles, validates, and analyzes data in order to prepare accurate and timely customer invoices, schedules, reconciliations, and journal entries to ensure the company's flow of cash and revenue. This information is critical to support timely and accurate monthly close procedures and supporting schedules.  

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.* Responsible for processing (manually or via a BOT process) and validating monthly invoices for assigned lines of business by compiling and reconciling billing data from multiple sources
* Reviews monthly invoices ensuring billing activity is booked to the correct revenue accounts and is recognized properly in accordance with revenue recognition policy
* Collaborate with relationship managers, finance, and IT to ensure accurate billing and identify variances to work to resolution
* Prepares close schedules, accruals, journal entries, G/L account reconciliations, accounting activity reconciliations, and audit support to ensure SOX controls compliance
* Researches and responds to relationship Business Partners regarding customer billing inquiries
* Prepares and maintains a monthly manual aging to report on past due balances used to determine CECL allowance
* Performs monthly reconciliations of other account receivable balances to supporting documentation
* Demonstrate effective decision-making skills, applying critical thinking to understand short-terms and long-term impact
* Cross-train withing the department to act as back-up support for team members
* Maintain accurate and updated procedures and support process improvement
* Apply core competencies including Effective Communication, Accountability, Prioritization, Ownership, Technical Acumen, Operational Excellence, and Proactiveness


MINIMUM REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:* Two (2) years of Accounts Receivable Billing experience
* Advanced Excel skills
* Netsuite

  

OTHER REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:* Computer literate in Microsoft Office, Windows 10
* Aptitude to multi-task effectively and prioritize work in a fast-paced work environment with daily/monthly deadlines
* Prior exposure to SOX controls and the ability to quickly and appropriately respond to external Auditor inquiries a strong advantage
* Highly ethical professional with strong business acumen
* Ability to be exacting, thorough and with a high level of attentive to detail, while still meeting deadlines
* Analyze and resolve problems, offer sound solutions where needed
* Strong teamwork and communication skills
* Ability to clear the required background check


DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:* Bachelor’s degree (preferably in accounting)
* Understanding of accounting and/or revenue processes
* Understanding of SOX compliance


WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
This position is virtual and open to residents of the 50 states, D.C.
COMPENSATION & BENEFITS: Stride, Inc. considers a person’s education, experience, and qualifications, as well as the position’s work location, expected quality and quantity of work, required travel (if any), external market and internal value when determining a new employee’s salary level. Salaries will differ based on these factors, the position’s level and expected contribution, and the employee’s benefits elections. Offers will typically be in the bottom half of the range.
We anticipate the salary range to be $57,384.00 - $98,992.80. Eligible employees may receive a bonus. This salary is not guaranteed, as an individual’s compensation can vary based on several factors. These factors include, but are not limited to, geographic location, experience, training, education, and local market conditions. Stride offers a robust benefits package for eligible employees that can include health benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off.
Job Type
Regular
The above job is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as assigned by their supervisor. All employment is “at-will” as governed by the law of the state where the employee works. It is further understood that the “at-will” nature of employment is one aspect of employment that cannot be changed except in writing and signed by an authorized officer.*Stride, Inc. is a Federal Contractor, an Equal* *Opportunity/Affirmative* *Action Employer and a Drug-Free Workplace. title: Data Analyst
description:
BASIC FUNCTIONS: This position performs simple data management and analysis tasks within a specific functional area or data type. Requires moderate communication with data sources and contacts.  

  

QUALIFICATIONS:  

* Bachelor’s Degree (Engineering/Computer Science preferred but not required); or equivalent experience required.
* 2+ years’ experience in data management area with an analytical competencies demonstrated

  

TECHNICAL SKILLS:  

* Knowledge of development languages such as SQL, UNIX, Linux, HPCC, etc.
* Knowledge of various data types and formats including, but not limited to: XML, flat files, delimited, etc.
* Knowledge of data analysis tools and processes.
* Good research skills.
* Proofreading skills to see how data and facts can be linked together to create more meaningful conclusions.
* Ability and desire to learn new processes, tools, and technologies.
* Good attention to detail.
* Good oral and written communications skills.

  

ACCOUNTABILITIES:  

* Business support through general data analysis and research.
* Use pre-designed queries to assess data for research purposes.
* General content matter subject matter expert.
* Investigate, track, and report general data issues.
* Under guidance of senior level Data Analyst, successfully complete new data onboarding and/or production data management functions as assigned/required.
* Conducts routine data review and verification and ensures corrections/clarifications are made in a timely manner.
* Utilize various data workflow management and analysis tools.
* Perform simple data problem solving within specific functional area or data type.

title: Business Data Analyst (Hybrid)
description:

title: Data Analyst
description:
ARCSys Technologies is a software as a service (SaaS) provider for the financial services industry that is looking to hire a Data Analyst to work with our Data Science Team. The Data Analyst will support the creation of statistical and analytical reports that interpret clients' loan and investment historical data and will turn this data into reference-able information used by clients to model their credit risk and other business modeling decisions.

The Data Analyst will gather information from various sources (both internal and external) and interpret patterns and trends – analyzing the impact of multiple economic factors and indicators and assisting with the development of predictive forecasting models. Once data has been gathered and interpreted, the Data Analyst will support the reporting function to clients of the results and recommendations.

**Experience**

* Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on analysis and insights
* Experience using statistical computer languages (Python, SQL, & R) to extract and manipulate data
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams
* A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
* Experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models; knowledge in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.
* Experience visualizing/presenting data using (Tableau, Microsoft BI, MatPlotLib, D3, etc.)
* Self-motivated and enjoys working from home
* Identifying patterns and determining causes associated with patterns

**Preferred Experience**

* More than 1 year of experience in SQL
* AWS experience (Redshift, Quicksight, and Sagemaker)
* Atlassian Suite experience (Jira, Confluence, Slack, etc.)
* More than 1 year of experience in Google Suite and/or Microsoft Suite
* Accounting and/or economic knowledge

**Qualifications** 

Bachelors degree in Statistics, Mathematics, or other quantitative fields

title: Data Integrity Analyst
description:
**General Summary:**
====================


Responsibilities include auditing SKU information to ensure accurate product set up, managing recalls,, as well as setting up and maintaining SKUs as needed. This person will work across categories and departments to ensure the highest level of data integrity in all systems down to the store level.**Principle Duties & Responsibilities:**
========================================

* Perform ongoing audits of SKU level information to ensure integrity is consistent across our Distribution Centers and Retek in order to ensure that items are set up accurately and completely, ensuring accurate item sales and margin data. Communicate necessary corrections and follow up on completion.
* Assist with Quality & Compliance and the Analyst, DSD and Trait Management on product recalls and product holds, including DC holds and store stop ships, using the Compliance Workflow.
* Maintain all Merchandising Hierarchy changes including but not limited to classes, subclasses and or department class for the Planning Department on Fashion/Seasonal Goods, which is critical for reporting information accurately and maintaining integrity in the Family Dollar Data Warehouse.
* Responsible for creation and maintenance of User Defined Attributes and Values along with Product Decision Hierarchy.
* Assist as key point of contact to the DCs on item inquires, ensuring a prompt response is provided and assistance is either provided or provide contacts in appropriate departments
* Monitor, respond and educate business partners on Centralized Item mailbox
* Responsible for providing information to the Merchandising staff in order to correct current data integrity issues within the Retek system.
* Responsible for training and creating learning experiences to continuously educate Merchandising on the importance of data integrity and their roles in the processes and procedures
* Responsible to maintain service level agreement of 3 days, seeking help as need to remain on track and providing updates to Merchandising Leadership when timeframe is in jeopardy.
* Responsible for reporting new items to Risk Management for determination of hazmat coding, and for requesting Material Safety Data Sheets from buying teams.
* Complete all SKU setup and maintenance to SKUs in order to ensure the highest level of data integrity across the chain, as needed.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Position Requirements:**
==========================

* Office work environment, 40+ work hours per week
* Demonstrates a positive attitude towards working in a team environment; understands others’ roles; “rolls up his/her sleeves” when necessary in order to get the job done.
* Balances quality and thoroughness with the need for timeliness and speed.
* Applies job knowledge effectively and demonstrates confidence in making routine decisions.
* Organizes his/her work and prioritizes projects.
* Seeks help from others when necessary.
* Understands and responds to both routine and unfamiliar directions and requests.
* Accurately establishes and maintains information with 100% accuracy.
* Processes requests in an effective and time efficient manner.
* Successfully meet and exceed customer’s expectations by delivering superior customer service.
* Ability to work independently.
* Ability to multi-task while maintaining focus and composure.
* Ability to be flexible and work outside of the normal business hours as business necessity dictates.
* Ability to effectively communicate with internal customers and vendors.
* Demonstrates an outlook that doesn’t reflect a “that’s not part of my job” attitude when the need arises to assist with duties and
* responsibilities located outside of the assigned duties of the position.
* Cross-train and serve as backup to other merchandise data related areas as needed.

**Minimum Requirements:**
=========================

*Education:* College Degree preferred or equivalent experience.
  

*Experience:* 2-3 Years in Retail Stores or Merchandising  

*Job Related Skills:* Proven track record in priority setting and managing multiple tasks and strong written and communication skills with excellent organizational skills. Applicant must have high attention to detail, strong work ethic and ability to work in a fast paced environment.  

Computer Skills: Must be proficient in using Microsoft Office Suite; SQL Developer. Ability to quickly learn new systems and business tools  

  

Dollar Tree and Family Dollar are Equal Opportunity employers.

title: Scheduling Data Analyst - Division of Finance
description:
University Overview
The University of Pennsylvania, the largest private employer in Philadelphia, is a world-renowned leader in education, research, and innovation. This historic, Ivy League school consistently ranks among the top 10 universities in the annual U.S. News & World Report survey. Penn has 12 highly-regarded schools that provide opportunities for undergraduate, graduate and continuing education, all influenced by Penn’s distinctive interdisciplinary approach to scholarship and learning. As an employer Penn has been ranked nationally on many occasions with the most recent award from Forbes who named Penn one of America’s Best Large Employers in 2023.
Penn offers a unique working environment within the city of Philadelphia. The University is situated on a beautiful urban campus, with easy access to a range of educational, cultural, and recreational activities. With its historical significance and landmarks, lively cultural offerings, and wide variety of atmospheres, Philadelphia is the perfect place to call home for work and play.
The University offers a competitive benefits package that includes excellent healthcare and tuition benefits for employees and their families, generous retirement benefits, a wide variety of professional development opportunities, supportive work and family benefits, a wealth of health and wellness programs and resources, and much more.
Posted Job Title
Scheduling Data Analyst - Division of Finance
Job Profile Title
Data Analyst C
Job Description Summary
The Office of the University Registrar (OUR) Scheduling team seeks an experienced Scheduling Data Analyst to join its Scheduling team.  

  

The Scheduling team plays a critical role in supporting scheduling, registration, academic calendaring, and classroom management. Led by the Associate Registrar for Classrooms, Calendars, and Scheduling, the team oversees the maintenance of course sections and registration data, schedules classes, final exams and academic events, analyzes alternative academic calendars, configures scheduling and registration functions for the University, and supports student facing registration systems.  

  

The team provides in-depth knowledge of the complexities of course scheduling, possesses exceptional problem-solving skills and innovative solutions, participates in the design and testing of new scheduling-related functionality, and ensures data accuracy of section and registration data.  

  

The role supports university-wide academic scheduling, in accordance with established policy, to allocate approximately 200 classrooms for classes, exams, and academic special events. This position ensures adherence to academic scheduling timelines and supports numerous functional areas that rely upon accurate scheduling data to support Capital Planning and critical campus construction projects. The ideal candidate possesses strong administrative, organizational, communication, and data entry skills.  

  

The role as the first point of contact for the OUR Scheduling team and manages the coordination of technical support requests. As part of the Scheduling team, the role will manage complex classroom requests and will have regular engagement with department faculty and staff.  

  

The role must have excellent written and verbal communication skills. The team is often scheduling for 2-3 terms at a time and must be able to pivot between terms and years without error and full accuracy.  

  

The role will manage accurate section and registration data to support student success, academic policy, and operational excellence. The role will possess the ability to multi-task, work independently, and be accountable for meeting operational deadlines.  

  

The role performs data analysis and assists with design of complex data models based upon business or research requirements. The role identifies and resolves required information flows and content issues,,and transforms requirements into data designs and models.  

  

The role performs analyses, development and evaluation on large databases and large complex installations and provide reporting and decision support systems consultation.
Job Description
Job Responsibilities* Serve as the initial point of contact for all scheduling support requests submitted by campus partners across the University, ensuring efficient management and coordination of these requests using complex technologies, programs and databases with full accuracy and proficiency with Penn systems and processes.
* Oversee and manage the scheduling of approximately 200 Central Pool classrooms for various academic purposes, including regular classes, final examinations, and events, ensuring optimal utilization and adherence to academic policies using complex technologies and technical programs.
* Maintain accurate and timely course section and registration data, contributing to the success of the student body and upholding academic and operational standards.
* Engage regularly with faculty and departmental staff to manage classroom requests, fostering positive relationships and efficient communication channels.
* Uphold strict deadlines for operational tasks, demonstrating the ability to multitask, work independently, and maintain accountability for meeting scheduling objectives.
* Support other OUR initiatives and other duties as assigned
* Identifies trends or patterns that result in data quality issues.
* Monitor data for accuracy, create audit reports.
* Make recommendations to improve systems design, data entry and processes to ensure accurate data.
* Develop reports, presentations and work with OUR leadership to identify and develop metrics for all aspects of School activities, transactional, strategic, and projections.
* Support the development of key metrics that may be used by the highest level leadership for strategic planning and budgeting.
* Develop dashboards to provide snapshots of key data. Disseminate reports and metrics to users.
* Development of new training materials.
* Other duties and responsibilities as assigned


Qualifications* Bachelor of Science and 2 to 3 years of job related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
* Experience in a central registrar’s office or in a comparable area of academic administration or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
* High degree of flexibility, perseverance, mental focus, and ability to pivot between different terms and academic years without compromising data accuracy or operational efficiency.
* In-depth knowledge of academic scheduling complexities and constraints, coupled with excellent problem-solving abilities and innovative thinking.
* Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively within a team and to engage in the design and implementation of scheduling solutions.
* Commitment to upholding the academic and operational standards of the University through meticulous attention to detail and data accuracy.
* Maintain strict confidentiality and consistency in accordance with FERPA and other laws/regulations at Penn and other regulatory and compliance agencies/laws.
* Technical proficiency working with student information systems, customer support software, and reporting tools.
* Strong commitment for innovation as demonstrated by their ability to be proactive, dynamic, forward-thinking, strategic, and collaborative.
* Proven ability to implement and manage change.
* Experience working in a large, decentralized, and complex higher education environment.
* Familiar with higher education best practices related to institutional research and data management
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, facilitating clear and effective interaction with faculty, staff, and other stakeholders.
* Proven track record in administrative roles, ideally within an academic setting, showcasing strong organizational and data entry skills.


Preferred:* Experience with technical skills and management scheduling in a decentralized university system and complex higher education environment.
* Experience in Banner, CLSS, and Infosilem programs and various higher education technologies.
* Proven record of exemplary customer service and competency and willingness to multi-task and shift to various priorities.
* Strong sense of time management including independent and collaborative work with across tight deadlines and goals.
* Ability to thrive in a Team-centered working environment.
* Effective communication skills that helps establish collegial and professional rapport with campus stakeholders. Ability to communicate/navigate without complete solutions and ambiguous and changing environments.

Philadelphia, Pennsylvania
Department / School
Division of Finance
Pay Range
$51,824.00 - $85,000.00 Annual Rate

If you apply when you’re newly hired, you won’t have to provide proof of good health or be subject to underwriting requirements. title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
**THE COMPANY:**  

  

NedGraphics (www.nedgraphics.com) provides specialized CAD/CAM design software for fashion, retail, home textiles, carpet and flooring, and other textile industries. The NedGraphics products allow designers full creative freedom for Print, Jacquard, Dobby and Knitted fabric design, as well as Carpet, Rug and Tuft design, while improving efficiency, productivity, and accuracy to create production-ready artwork. NedGraphics for Adobe® (formerly Aquario Design, EFI Fiery DesignPro, and Generation Digital) provides textile plugins within Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator, on both Mac and PC, to create prints, knits, wovens, fashion sketching, and more.  

  

Optitex (www.optitex.com) is the leading global provider of integrated 2D/3D product development software solutions for the fashion, apparel, transportation interiors, and furniture markets. With three decades of experience and over 30,000 installations worldwide, Optitex delivers a comprehensive range of tools that assist and accelerate the product development process, reducing returns, enhancing sustainability, and boosting operational excellence.  

  

NedGraphics and Optitex are portfolio companies of FOG Software Group (www.fogsoftwaregroup.com), which is a subsidiary of Constellation Software Inc. (www.csisoftware.com). Constellation is listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange and is a conglomerate of vertical market software companies. Constellation has completed over 800 acquisitions since inception in 1995 and is all about strengthening these businesses and enabling them to grow – whether through organic measures such as new initiatives and product development, day-to-day business, or through acquisitions. As is Constellation’s unique model, FOG Software buys and holds companies forever, which requires continuous investment in our businesses - their products, brands, and people - and a long-term horizon for strategic decisions.  

  

**POSITION DESCRIPTION:**  

  

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who will be a driving force in optimizing our Salesforce and HubSpot platforms, while leveraging other inputs from back office and finance, to streamline sales processes and deliver data-driven insights.  

  

**ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES:*** Develop and maintain web-based PowerBI dashboards and reports to monitor sales KPIs and performance such as MQLs and SQLs, pipe coverage by stage, conversion rates, sales velocity, close date pushes, and various segmentations (e.g., by product, region, size, license vs. subscription, direct vs. indirect, net new vs. back-to-base customer) for pipe and bookings, etc.
* Consolidate real-time data from Salesforce, HubSpot, back office, and financial reporting into the dashboards that are easily accessible and customizable.
* Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform decision-making.
* Prepare reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations.
* Communicate insights effectively to stakeholders using data visualization tools.
* Assist in revenue forecasting, pipeline analysis, and performance tracking.
* Understand how users utilize and want to utilize Salesforce and HubSpot and link this with the business needs and expectations. Drive continuous improvement and look for opportunities to increase efficiency and implement best practices, either directly or via third party CRM implementation partners.
* Create user-friendly training guides and documentation. Conduct training sessions for new and existing users on Salesforce and HubSpot best practices and tailored workflows. Provide ongoing support to resolve user issues.
* Maintain data accuracy in Salesforce and HubSpot, develop data cleansing processes, and implement data quality controls.
* Longer-term, expand reporting to other functions including marketing, customer success, and engineering.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**
===================

* Bachelor’s degree in finance, statistics, or a related field.
* 2+ years of experience in an analytics role, preferably in a software sales setting.
* Strong knowledge of the sales tech stacks of Salesforce and HubSpot. Associated certifications a plus.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques including PowerBI, Tableau, MS Excel and PowerPoint, SQL, etc.
* Experience building dashboards with various KPIs, pulling in data from multiple sources.
* Ability to use advanced analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills in a fast-paced environment while managing various requests. Experience uncovering trends and distilling key insights into digestible formats.
* Familiarity with accounting and forecasting models, tools, and processes.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to distill complex ideas simply and effectively.
* Strong interpersonal skills and comfortable working directly with a variety of roles from management to end users, distributed globally, with varying levels of system experience and capability.

  

NedGraphics and Optitex have offices across North America, Europe, and Asia. The role is remote with occasional in-person internal meetings.

title: RESEARCH DATA ANALYST, School of Public Health, Epidemiology
description:
The Research Data Analyst will primarily be responsible for spatial and cohort data management, and statistical analysis of data for various grants focused on environmental determinants of health, dementia, and health inequities at the Boston University School of Public Health. The Research Data Analyst will be in charge of leveraging and harmonizing spatial data to study environmental exposures (green space, air pollution, ambient temperature, noise, walkability, neighborhood amenities, access to transit, and neighborhood deprivation), across the US and link to geocoded participant data. Additional responsibilities will include drafting progress reports, protocol and analysis documentation, and manuscript preparation. The Data Analyst will primarily use R statistical software to perform analyses and will be critical to ensuring the timely presentation and publication of results from multiple grants. Assistance with grant writing may also be required.
  

  

**Essential functions:**
  

  

Download and create a database of environmental exposures (green space, air pollution, ambient temperature, noise, walkability, neighborhood amenities, access to transit, and neighborhood deprivation), across the US. We will download spatial data layers on green space, air pollution, ambient temperature, noise, walkability and neighborhood deprivation for the whole US across time. They would need to homogenize the spatial resolution across these layers to be able to create a final time-varying stack of environmental exposures. This final stack of environmental exposures will be linked to cohort data to examine associations between environmental features and dementia risk factors.
  

  

Harmonize spatial data layers according to spatial resolution and time of assessment. Perform data management on spatial variables that come as a result of the harmonization process to facilitate analyses. The latter may include cleaning raw data, deriving new variables (e.g. annual average, seasonal average), label and formatting derived variables.
  

  

Perform statistical analyses to examine associations with dementia risk factors. These analyses may include descriptive statistics, stratification, multivariable regression, survival analysis, longitudinal data analysis, using R software.
  

  

Document processes involved in data preparation, manipulation, and statistical analysis. The methodology followed will be documented for internal processes,
  

  

Prepare preliminary results for inclusion in conference presentations, grants, and scientific publications (e.g., tables, figures). Education and experience: Masters degree in Biostatistics and/or Geospatial Sciences is strongly preferred 1-3 years of relevant work experience

  


  

  

Required Skills  

Master's degree required with 1 - 3 years of experience.  

  

*We* *are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, natural or protective hairstyle, religion, sex, age, national origin, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military service,* *pregnancy* *or pregnancy-related condition, or because of marital, parental, or veteran status.* *We are a VEVRAA Federal Contractor**.*

title: Data Analytics Specialist
description:
Notre Dame Federal Credit Union humbly began in 1941 as a conversation between two professors from the University of Notre Dame. Now, over 75 years later, we have grown into a national, award-winning financial institution serving over 56,000 members worldwide. We consider our partners (employees) to be one of our greatest assets to this success. We strive to make great things happen for our members and partners by changing one life every day. If you share that same passion for making an impact on someone’s life, you should apply to join the Notre Dame FCU family.


  
**PRIMARY FUNCTION:**

The Primary function of the Data Analytics Specialist is to ensure the secure, efficient operation and continuous availability of the Credit Union’s Enterprise Data Warehouse, application specific databases, and multiple reporting environments. Works with the Manager of Business Intelligence to identify, recommend, develop, implement, and support analytic solutions for the Credit Union. This position is also responsible for leading our business reporting initiatives including proactive identification of data trends and resulting opportunities.  



**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBLITIES:**

This position must effectively carry out the essential duties of this position in a manner that consistently demonstrates the core values of Notre Dame Federal Credit Union in a positive manner. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The duties identified below are the essential functions of the position and other duties may be assigned.  



* Create, manage and monitor automated jobs for data ingress and transformation - ETL processes from various data sources internal and external to the credit union.
* Create and maintain scheduled reporting using SSRS, Visual Studios and Tableau.
* Create scheduled and ad hoc reports from the core financial system.
* Develop, create, and maintain data lakes and dashboards in Tableau and other similar product (PowerBI).
* Responsible for researching emerging processes, preparing recommendations for business solutions, and creating work instructions.
* Identify data trends and new opportunities for data gathering and/or enhance existing models to drive higher levels of performance throughout the organization.
* Drive user adoption of reporting tools to allow for efficient data consumption.
* Perform ad-hoc and operational reporting requests which might include off-hours support as needed for system issues.
* Cooperate with IT Department for system / network upgrades, support of data ingress and ETL processes.
Maintain communications with critical external entities to ensure ETL processes run in time, and data is available including periodic scheduled data updates are completed.  
* 

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

None  



**PERFORMANCE STANDARDS:**

The performance standards for this position include the following key areas:


* Stays abreast of rules and regulations as they pertain to the operation of this department.
* To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.

  
**QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:**

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  



EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:


* Bachelor’s degree in Business Intelligence, Computer Science, Computer Information Systems or a similar degree plus three (3) to five (5) years BI/Computers/Information Technology, or equivalent experience.
* Microsoft SQL proficiency and certifications.
* Experience in developing reports using Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and using Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
* Proficiency in Microsoft SQL Server T-SQL for programming stored procedures.
* Experience with implementing, maintaining, tuning, and deploying SQL and IIS based applications.
* Strong interpersonal skills, oral communication skills, and proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Understanding of relational database structures, theories, principles, and practices.
* Practical knowledge in importing data for use in spreadsheets, graphs, and flow charts.
* Strong technical knowledge of data management systems, data warehousing methodology, data quality, data modelling, data governance, analytics, and predictive modeling.
* Experience with a data visualization tool – Tableau or PowerBI
Experience at a financial institute a plus.  
* 

LANGUAGE SKILLS:


The ability to read, write, and speak in English is required. Must be able to read and interpret highly technical documents. The position requires the ability to convey technical issues and material to a non-technical audience. The ability to read and comprehend rules and regulations that pertain to the areas of responsibility of the department is required.  



MATHEMATICAL SKILLS:


The ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume is required.  



REASONING ABILITY:


The ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form as well as the ability to develop solutions to problems as they arise.


PHYSICAL DEMANDS:


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a partner to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  



While performing the duties of this job, the partner is regularly required to handle or feel objects with your hands, use tools, or controls and talk and hear. The partner frequently is required to walk and sit. The partner is occasionally required to stand, reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, peripheral vision, and the ability to adjust focus. The partner must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds.


MENTAL DEMANDS:


The partner is frequently required to use alertness, precision, resourcefulness, problem solving, numeric, persuasiveness, auditory perception, memory, creativity, concentration, judgment, writing ability, reading ability, reasoning, imagination, initiative, patience, visual perception, comparing and analyzing.  



WORK ENVIRONMENT:


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those a partner encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate.  



REGULATORY COMPLIANCE & CONFIDENTIALITY:


Follows regulatory and policy compliance requirements, which would include those efforts in compliance with Bank Secrecy Act (BSA), Office of Foreign Asset Control (OFAC) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Regulations, and other compliance related Policies. Also, this position requires maintaining confidentiality regarding non-public information about our members and Notre Dame Federal Credit Union.

description:
